DataElement.preferredName: Preoperative Ostomy Education Stoma Quality of Life Scale Received Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of Stoma Quality of Life Scale related to preoperative education being given regarding an ostomy, an opening (a stoma) from an area inside the body to the outside, being created durig the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Preoperative Ostomy Education Quality of Life Received
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to preoperative education being given regarding an ostomy, an opening (a stoma) from an area inside the body to the outside, being created durig the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ in relation to quality of life assessment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation. :Surgical construction of an artificial opening (stoma) for external fistulization of a duct or vessel by insertion of a tube with or without a supportive stent.:The activities of educating or instructing or teaching; activities that impart knowledge or skill.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.
Surgical creation of an opening in an organ.
The activities of educating or instructing or teaching; activities that impart knowledge or skill.

Property.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.:Received; taken, gotten, or acquired.

Concepts.definition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Stoma Quality of Life Scale Status
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the status of Stoma Quality of Life Scale.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueDomain.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form
